name: .box_cheat_sheet
description: When you’re learning Scala, one of the first concepts that clicks is pattern matching. Once you get the “hammer” of pattern matching in your Scala toolbox, everything is a nail; you want to use it everywhere for everything. Pattern matching is very powerful and easy to use, but it turns out for many, many simple cases using a higher-order function is more concise and performant. I have Tony Morris’s Option Cheat Sheet .

View.val: Activate the Copy File pop-up for the selected file
